content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
###Copper Cable Factory at (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Input Chest at (2.5, 17.5) serving as the factory interface.
- Burner Inserter at (3.5, 17.5) (placed with direction RIGHT) that feeds items into the factory.
- Assembling Machine (assembling-machine-1) at (1.5, 19.5) intended for copper cable production.

###Extraction System at (-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
- Burner Inserter at (-3.5, 27.5) with a drop position at (-3.5, 28.5) used to extract and dispatch items.

###Depot Belt Depot at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden Chest at (3.5, 15.5) serving as an isolated belt depot.
- Transport Belt Segment at (4.5, 15.5) placed adjacent to the depot chest.
- Depot Burner Inserter at (3.5, 14.5) (placed with direction UP) whose pickup position is the depot chest (3.5, 15.5) and drop position is (3.5, 13.5).

###Electricity Generator at (-0.5, 24.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Steam Engine at (-0.5, 24.5) that forms the core of the generator.
- Boiler at (-5.5, 24.0) which heats the water for steam production.
- Offshore Pump at (-7.5, 25.5) that supplies water to the system.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
 – Avoid targeting a Prototype.SteamEngine directly when connecting transport belts. Always insert an appropriate inserter to serve as the interface target.

• Wooden Chest Placement Issues  
 – Confirm that the target placement position is within the allowed distance. Ensure you are sufficiently close to the intended spot and that the required wooden chest is available in the inventory before attempting placement.

• Variable Naming Mistake  
 – Use consistent and correctly defined variable names (for example, use target_place_pos or depot_chest instead of an undefined name like target_chest) to prevent reference errors.

• Connection Retry Protocol  
 – After a failed connection attempt, incorporate a wait period to allow system stabilization before reattempting belt connections.
